item.title: The GenAI Divide: Why 95% Still Get Zero ROI
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: MIT’s 2025 State of AI in Business report reveals a stark truth: 95% of enterprises get zero ROI from GenAI. The problem isn’t the technology—it’s the approach. In this analysis, I break down the real causes of failure and what leaders must do to cross the GenAI Divide.

item.title: The Emails We Deleted, The Value We Never Saw Coming
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: A strategic retrospective on how the corporate storage caps of the 2000s inadvertently destroyed valuable AI training data—and the mandate for today’s leaders to practice deliberate retention.

item.title: If Your Strategy Starts With a Deck, It’s Already Wrong
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Most corporate “strategy” work starts with months of pre-work and thick decks, and never reaches the real question: why did our past choices produce the results they did? Drawing on Roger Martin’s strategy-as-choices framework, I argue that strategy must begin with the gap between intent and outcome and remain the direct responsibility of the executive leadership team.

item.title: Designing Around Constraints
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Explains why Git stores loose objects in 256 subdirectories keyed by the first two hash characters and how that simple layout optimizes filesystem performance and scalability.

item.title: The Original Blockchain Was Carved in Stone
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Long before digital wallets, the people of Yap solved the hardest problems in finance using 4-ton limestone rocks. This article explores how ancient ‘Rai’ stones utilized the same principles—scarcity, consensus, and proof-of-work—that underpin modern digital currencies and blockchain technology today.

item.title: AIrSpace
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: Argues that AI risks driving banks toward visual and experiential sameness—‘AIrSpace’—and challenges leaders to preserve differentiation through vision, brand, and execution.

item.title: Reshaping the Future of Banking & Finance
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: The Asian Banker provides a comprehensive overview of the ’triad of disruption’ facing financial institutions today. The article details how the simultaneous maturation of Generative AI, Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs), and decentralized architectures is moving beyond experimentation to become the core infrastructure of future finance.

item.title: The Next Chapter of the Web
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: The internet’s ‘original sin’ was the lack of a native payment layer. This report explores x402, a new protocol that utilizes the HTTP 402 status code to enable instant, autonomous stablecoin payments for AI agents and the modern web.

item.title: Central Bank Digital Currencies will Redefine Money
item.author: john@januszczak.org (John Januszczak)
item.description: An analysis of the global shift toward Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs), highlighting the transition from physical cash to programmable money. The article explores how CBDCs—exemplified by initiatives like the Philippines’ Project Agila and the BIS mBridge project—will revolutionize monetary policy through granular control, improved AML compliance, and new cross-border settlement rails.
